first_reading.text:
[[Dt 6,4]]Moses said to the people: "Hear, O Israel! The LORD is our God, the LORD alone!
[[Dt 6,5]]Therefore, you shall love the LORD, your God, with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength.
[[Dt 6,6]]Take to heart these words which I enjoin on you today.
[[Dt 6,7]]Drill them into your children. Speak of them at home and abroad, whether you are busy or at rest.
[[Dt 6,8]]Bind them at your wrist as a sign and let them be as a pendant on your forehead.
[[Dt 6,9]]Write them on the doorposts of your houses and on your gates.
[[Dt 6,10]]"When the LORD, your God, brings you into the land which he swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, that he would give you, a land with fine, large cities that you did not build,
[[Dt 6,11]]with houses full of goods of all sorts that you did not garner, with cisterns that you did not dig, with vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant; and when, therefore, you eat your fill,
[[Dt 6,12]]take care not to forget the LORD, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, that place of slavery.
[[Dt 6,13]]The LORD, your God, shall you fear; him shall you serve, and by his name shall you swear."
first_reading.title: Book of Deuteronomy

gospel.text:
[[Mt 17,14]]A man approached Jesus, knelt down before him,
[[Mt 17,15]]and said, "Lord, have pity on my son, for he is a lunatic and suffers severely; often he falls into fire, and often into water.
[[Mt 17,16]]I brought him to your disciples, but they could not cure him."
[[Mt 17,17]]Jesus said in reply, "O faithless and perverse generation, how long will I be with you? How long will I endure you? Bring him here to me."
[[Mt 17,18]]Jesus rebuked him and the demon came out of him, and from that hour the boy was cured.
[[Mt 17,19]]Then the disciples approached Jesus in private and said, "Why could we not drive it out?"
[[Mt 17,20]]He said to them, "Because of your little faith. Amen, I say to you, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, 'Move from here to there,' and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

psalm.text:
[[Ps 18,2]]I love you, O LORD, my strength,
[[Ps 18,3a]]O LORD, my rock, my fortress, my deliverer.

[[Ps 18,3b]]My God, my rock of refuge,
[[Ps 18,3c]]my shield, the horn of my salvation, my stronghold!
[[Ps 18,4]]Praised be the LORD, I exclaim, 
and I am safe from my enemies.

[[Ps 18,47]]The LORD lives! And blessed be my rock! 
Extolled be God my savior.
[[Ps 18,51a]]You who gave great victories to your king
[[Ps 18,51b]]and showed kindness to your anointed;

to David and his posterity forever
psalm.title: Psalms
